title: Transformer-Based Architectures for Code Generation
abstract: This paper explores the application of transformer-based architectures for automatic code generation, with a focus on improving accuracy and maintaining code quality.
content: This paper explores the application of transformer-based architectures for automatic code generation, with a focus on improving accuracy and maintaining code quality. We present a novel approach that combines pre-training on large code repositories with fine-tuning on domain-specific codebases. Our model demonstrates significant improvements over previous approaches in terms of syntactic correctness, semantic accuracy, and code readability. We also introduce a new benchmark for evaluating code generation systems across multiple programming languages and problem domains.
citationFormat: Zhang, A., Le, D., & Williams, S. (2022). Transformer-Based Architectures for Code Generation. In Proceedings of the 44th International Conference on Software Engineering (ICSE), pp. 789-800.
